alert.note: Alert for Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:40PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ETOWAH AND ST. CLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM CST... At 1040 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Odenville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pell City, Leeds, Moody, Rainbow City, Springville, Odenville, Margaret, Argo, Ashville, Riverside, Ragland, Steele, Bald Rock, Harrisburg, Branchville, Neely Henry Lake, Logan Martin Lake, Whitney Junction, Alabama International Dragway, and Wattsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and northeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and east central Alabama.
